column4: i use the xine backend for totem and i think its a lot better, that has menus etc.
how do i do that?
apt-get install totem-xine
the only thing i can think of is if your graphics drivers don't like it, and so your x server dies, and gets restarted
what graphics drivers are you using?
yet they play without menus in totem-gstreamer?
well you should be able to change by right clicking and skipping to chapter, but that's far from ideal. Thing is if gstreamer can play it, why can't anything else
to put totem back to playing them without menus do apt-get install totem-gstreamer by the way
all i can think of is the output method causing the problem in xine... are you usig xgl or anything by the way?
yea im using fglrx
i wonder if totem-xine would work in a plain x session...
can you test that?
how ?
i tried to play dvds from the cmd line with mplayer but that didnt work either, altho i did get sound
with vlc it just closes the program after a segmentation error, and mplayer i cant remember what it said...
now mplayer is saying that it cant be installed on my computer type (amd64)
sorry this is taking so long
i'm not sure, haven't ever used the ati drivers
(mplayer is compiling btw)
mv
im done haha, opening up gmplayer gives me errors instantly...
ah well, at least you've got somethign to work with,
